name: Glen Affric Memorial Cairn Viewpoint Path

ai.summary: A short, easy 0.6 km hike to a memorial cairn viewpoint in the Glen Affric area. The trail is a gentle path suitable for most walkers and typically offers peaceful scenery of the surrounding landscape.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily a level or gently graded path of compact gravel and grass. Occasional exposed roots or small steps may occur. After rain, sections can become muddy; the route remains short and easy overall.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly—dress in layers and bring a waterproof. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip. Stay on marked paths and monitor footing on any exposed roots or damp sections. The route is short but daylight can be limited in winter; carry a map or device with offline access and tell someone your plan. Bring water and snacks, and keep dogs under friendly control.
recommended_gear: Light rain jacket and/or windproof layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) offer the best conditions, with longer days and typically drier weather. Winter visits are possible but expect mud, ice, and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Glen Affric Memorial Cairn Viewpoint Path – Easy 0.6 km Hike in the UK
